Interface ISimulation


  • public interface ISimulation

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAirport(java.lang.String code, java.lang.String name, GridLocation location)
      Adds an airport to the simulation.
      void addPlane(java.lang.String callsign, java.lang.String startAirport, java.lang.String destinationAirport)
      Adds a plane to the simulation.
      IAirport getAirport(java.lang.String code)
      Returns the object for a specific named airport.
      java.util.List<IAirport> getAirports() 
      GridLocation getMapDimensions()
      Gets the dimensions of the simulated world, in grid squares.
      IPlane getPlane(java.lang.String callSign)
      Returns the object for a specific named plane.
      java.util.List<IPlane> getPlanes() 
      int getSimTime() 
      void movePlaneTo(java.lang.String planeName, GridLocation newLoc)
      Moves the specified plane to the specified location, provided that the specified move is legal.
      void pause()
      If the simulator is currently running continuously (after a start() command), this stops it running.
      void setMapDimensions(int width, int height)
      Sets the dimensions of the simulated world, in grid squares.
      void setTickDelay(int millis)
      Sets the delay between ticks when the simulation is running continuously (after a start() command).
      void start()
      Starts the simulator running continuously, at a rate determined by the most recent call to setTickDelay(), and returns.
      void tick()
      Tells the simulator to move simulated time forward by one tick, and take any actions that should occur in that time.

    • Method Detail

      • addPlane

        void addPlane(java.lang.String callsign,
              java.lang.String startAirport,
              java.lang.String destinationAirport)
        Adds a plane to the simulation.
        Parameters:
        callsign - The callsign of the plane to be added
        startAirport - The IATA code for the airport the plane took-off from
        destinationAirport - The IATA code for the airport the plane is flying to
        Throws:
        SimulationException - if either airport does not exist
        SimulationException - if a plane with the same call sign already exists

      • getPlanes

        java.util.List<IPlane> getPlanes()
        Returns:
        a list of the planes in the simulation

      • getPlane

        IPlane getPlane(java.lang.String callSign)
        Returns the object for a specific named plane.
        Parameters:
        callSign - the name of the plane
        Returns:
        The named plane
        Throws:
        SimulationException - if the named plane does not exist in the simulation

      • addAirport

        void addAirport(java.lang.String code,
                java.lang.String name,
                GridLocation location)
        Adds an airport to the simulation.
        Parameters:
        code - The IATA code for the airport
        name - The full name of the airport
        location - The grid location of the airport

      • getAirports

        java.util.List<IAirport> getAirports()
        Returns:
        a list of the airports in the simulation

      • getAirport

        IAirport getAirport(java.lang.String code)
        Returns the object for a specific named airport.
        Parameters:
        code - the IATA code for the airport
        Returns:
        The named airport
        Throws:
        SimulationException - if the named airport does not exist in the simulation

      • tick

        void tick()
        Tells the simulator to move simulated time forward by one tick, and take any actions that should occur in that time.

      • getSimTime

        int getSimTime()
        Returns:
        the number of ticks since the simulation was started

      • getMapDimensions

        GridLocation getMapDimensions()
        Gets the dimensions of the simulated world, in grid squares.
        Returns:
        the dimensions of the world

      • setMapDimensions

        void setMapDimensions(int width,
                      int height)
        Sets the dimensions of the simulated world, in grid squares.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the map
        height - the height of the map

      • movePlaneTo

        void movePlaneTo(java.lang.String planeName,
                 GridLocation newLoc)
        Moves the specified plane to the specified location, provided that the specified move is legal. If the move is not legal the method returns with no effect.
        Parameters:
        planeName - the name of the plane to move
        newLoc - the location to move the plane to

      • start

        void start()
        Starts the simulator running continuously, at a rate determined by the most recent call to setTickDelay(), and returns. If the simulator is already running, it does nothing.

      • pause

        void pause()
        If the simulator is currently running continuously (after a start() command), this stops it running. If the simulator is not running, does nothing.

      • setTickDelay

        void setTickDelay(int millis)
        Sets the delay between ticks when the simulation is running continuously (after a start() command).
        Parameters:
        millis - The real-time delay between ticks, in milliseconds
